sentences.en: He could not hide his embarrassment at his children’s rudeness.
sentences.cn: 他无法掩饰自己孩子的无礼给他带来的难堪。

sentences.en: I nearly died of embarrassment when he said that.
sentences.cn: 他说那话差点儿把我给难堪死了。

sentences.en: I think I would have died of embarrassment.
sentences.cn: 我觉得自己难堪得要死。

sentences.en: I wanted to spare Frances the embarrassment of discussing this subject.
sentences.cn: 讨论这个话题太尴尬，我不想让弗朗西斯难堪。

sentences.en: Mention sex therapy and most people will titter in embarrassment.
sentences.cn: 提及性治疗，大多数人会尴尬地偷笑。

sentences.en: She turned scarlet from embarrassment, once she realized what she had done.
sentences.cn: 她意识到自己做了什么后羞红了脸。

sentences.en: She went bright pink with embarrassment.
Some people have left out of embarrassment at what's happened to them.
sentences.cn: 一些人已经由于为发生在自己身上的事感到难堪而离开了。

sentences.en: The episode was a huge embarrassment for all concerned.
sentences.cn: 这段小插曲令所有有关人员都感到非常尴尬.

sentences.en: The facts could cause embarrassment if they ever became public.
sentences.cn: 一旦披露出去，真相会让人非常尴尬。

sentences.en: The man was being a positive embarrassment.
The poverty figures were undoubtedly an embarrassment to the president.
sentences.cn: 贫困数字毫无疑问让总统非常难堪。

sentences.en: The subject makes her writhe with embarrassment.
sentences.cn: 这个话题让她难堪得坐立不安。

sentences.en: This episode is bound to be a deep embarrassment for Washington.
sentences.cn: 这一事件肯定会让华盛顿非常难堪。

sentences.en: We apologise for any embarrassment this may have caused.
sentences.cn: 我们为因此可能带来的尴尬表示歉意。

words.tran_cn: 使人尴尬的；令人为难的
使人尴尬地；令人难堪地
使...困窘；使...局促不安（embarrass的过去分词形式）
使局促不安；使困窘；阻碍

trans.tran_cn: 尴尬，难堪（的事），使人为难（或难堪）的人
trans.tran_en: the feeling you have when you are embarrassed
